item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：摩根士丹利的客户筛选面临美国金融业监管局更深入的调查
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，美国金融业监管局（FINRA）正在就摩根士丹利如何筛查客户的洗钱风险展开调查。【原文：The U.S. Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) is investigating Morgan Stanley over how the firm screened clients for money-laundering risks, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 安宏资本支持的 NIQ 在美国首次公开募股中融资 10.5 亿美元
item.description: 由投资公司Advent International和KKR支持的消费者洞察公司NIQ Global [NIQ.N]周二表示，它在美国的首次公开募股中筹集了10.5亿美元。【原文：Consumer insights company NIQ Global [NIQ.N], backed by investment firms Advent International and KKR , said on Tuesday it had raised $1.05 billion in its initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 日本央行内田警告贸易不确定性将给经济带来下行风险
item.description: 日本央行副行长内田伸一周三表示，由于贸易政策及其对国内外经济增长的影响存在 "极高 "的不确定性，经济活动和物价面临的风险偏向下行。【原文：Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Shinichi Uchida said on Wednesday that risks to economic activity and prices were skewed to the downside due to "extremely high" uncertainty over trade policy and its effect on domestic and overseas growth.】

item.title: 据 NHK 报道，日本和美国同意维持目前对钢铁和铝征收 50%关税的做法
item.description: 据日本公共广播公司 NHK 周三报道，作为双边贸易协议的一部分，日本和美国同意维持目前对钢铁和铝征收 50%关税的做法。【原文：Japan and the United States agreed to keep the current 50% tariff on steel and aluminium as part of the bilateral trade deal, Japanese public broadcaster NHK reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 石油因日本贸易协议和美国库存显示需求强劲而上涨
item.description: 油价在连续三个交易日下跌后于周三早盘企稳，原因是美国与日本达成的贸易协议表明在关税问题上取得了进展，而且一项民意调查显示上周美国原油库存下降，表明需求强劲。【原文：Oil prices steadied in early trading on Wednesday after falling for three consecutive sessions as a U.S. trade deal with Japan signaled progress on tariffs and a poll showed U.S. crude stockpiles fell last week, indicating stronger demand.】

item.title: 美日关税协议的主要事实
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）和日本首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）周三表示，他们已达成一项贸易协议，其中包括对从日本进口的商品征收15%的关税。以下是我们目前了解到的情况。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba on Wednesday said they had struck a trade deal that will include a 15% tariff on imports from Japan. Here's what we know so far.】

item.title: 底特律三大汽车制造商对日本贸易协议表示担忧
item.description: 代表通用汽车、福特汽车和克莱斯勒母公司施泰兰特的一个团体周二对一项贸易协议表示担忧，因为该协议可能将从日本进口汽车的关税削减至 15%，同时将从加拿大和墨西哥进口汽车的关税维持在 25%。【原文：A group representing General Motors Ford and Chrysler-parent Stellantis on Tuesday raised concerns about a trade deal that could cut tariffs on auto imports from Japan to 15% while leaving tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico at 25%.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴推出开源人工智能编码模型，被誉为迄今为止最先进的人工智能模型
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团周三宣布推出 Qwen3-Coder，这是一个用于软件开发的开源人工智能模型，中国电子商务巨头称其为迄今为止最先进的编码工具。【原文：Alibaba Group announced on Wednesday the launch of Qwen3-Coder, an open-source artificial intelligence model for software development that the Chinese e-commerce giant described as its most advanced coding tool to date.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，美国核武器机构因微软 SharePoint 遭黑客入侵
item.description: 彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道称，美国国家核安全局是微软 SharePoint 文档管理软件被黑客入侵的对象之一。【原文：U.S. National Nuclear Security Administration was among those breached by a hack of Microsoft's SharePoint document management software, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布日本贸易协定，日经指数反弹提振亚洲股市
item.description: 周三，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布与日本达成贸易协议并燃起对未来更多贸易协议的希望之后，日本股市领涨亚洲股市，抵消了美国财报喜忧参半的影响。【原文：Japanese shares led an Asian share market rally on Wednesday after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with Japan and fuelled hopes of more to come, offsetting mixed U.S. earnings that highlighted the drags from higher tariffs.】

item.title: 淡水河谷铁矿石产量增长 4%，主要矿山第二季度产量创历史新高
item.description: 巴西矿业公司淡水河谷周二发布报告称，该公司第二季度铁矿石产量为 8360 万公吨，同比增长 3.7%。【原文：Brazilian miner Vale produced 83.6 million metric tons of iron ore in the second quarter, up 3.7% from a year earlier, the company reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: VIEW 对美国与日本达成贸易协议的反应
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，美国和日本已达成贸易协议，其中包括将对从日本进口的美国产品征收 15%的关税。【原文：President Donald Trump said the U.S. and Japan had struck a trade deal that includes a 15% tariff that will be levied on U.S. imports from the country.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布与日本达成贸易协议，包括征收 15%的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二宣布了一项与日本的贸易协议，他说该协议将导致日本向美国投资5500亿美元，并支付15%的对等关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday announced a trade deal with Japan that he said will result in Japan investing $550 billion into the United States and paying a 15% reciprocal tariff.】

item.title: 朝日新闻》报道：日本最高关税谈判代表在白宫会见特朗普
item.description: 据《朝日新闻》周三报道，日本最高关税谈判代表赤泽亮世周二在白宫会见了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普。【原文：Japan's top tariff negotiator, Ryosei Akazawa, met with U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House on Tuesday, the Asahi newspaper reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 各国央行应为气候对劳动力市场的冲击做好准备
item.description: 伦敦经济学院（London School of Economics）周三发表的一份报告警告说，除非各国央行彻底改革其货币政策方法，否则它们有可能被气候对全球劳动力市场造成的冲击打懵。【原文：Central banks risk being blindsided by climate-driven shocks to global labour markets unless they overhaul their approach to monetary policy, a report published on Wednesday by the London School of Economics warned.】

item.title: T-Mobile 的 5G 将助力 Comcast 和 Charter 的无线业务计划
item.description: 康卡斯特和 Charter Communications 周二表示，他们将成立一家移动虚拟网络运营商 (MVNO)，使用 T-Mobile 的 5G 网络为无线企业客户提供服务，计划于明年推出。【原文：Comcast and Charter Communications said on Tuesday they would establish a mobile virtual network operator (MVNO) that will use T-Mobile's 5G network to serve wireless business customers, with plans to launch next year.】

item.title: 波音公司向工会成员发出合同要约
item.description: 波音公司周二向在圣路易斯地区组装战斗机的工会成员发出了一份合同要约。【原文：Boeing sent a contract offer on Tuesday to union members who assemble its fighter jets in the St. Louis area.】

item.title: Enphase Energy 预计第三季度收入低于预期，股价下跌
item.description: Enphase Energy周二预测第三季度营收低于华尔街预期，并表示唐纳德-特朗普总统的进口关税影响了其毛利率，导致这家太阳能逆变器制造商盘后股价下跌超过7%。【原文：Enphase Energy forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Tuesday and said President Donald Trump's import tariffs had impacted its gross margin, sending the solar inverter maker's shares down more than 7% after hours.】

item.title: 亚马逊将收购专注于人工智能可穿戴设备的初创公司
item.description: 亚马逊已达成收购旧金山 Bee 公司的协议，该公司是一家初创企业，生产一种人工智能手环，用于监听和转录对话。【原文：Amazon has reached a deal to buy San Francisco-based Bee, a startup making an artificial intelligence-enabled bracelet to listen in on and transcribe conversations.】

item.title: 特朗普官员称印尼将在美国贸易协议中削减关税和非关税壁垒
item.description: 印尼和美国周二表示，印尼已同意取消对99%以上的美国商品征收的关税，并取消美国公司面临的所有非关税壁垒，而美国将把印尼产品的威胁关税从32%降至19%。【原文：Indonesia has agreed to eliminate tariffs on more than 99% of U.S. goods and scrap all non-tariff barriers facing American firms, while the U.S. will drop threatened tariffs on Indonesian products to 19% from 32%, the two countries said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 手术机器人需求强劲，直觉外科发布乐观季度财报
item.description: 本周二，直觉外科（Intuitive Surgical）第二季度利润和收入均超出华尔街预期，主要原因是市场对其用于微创手术的手术机器人的需求不断增长。【原文：Intuitive Surgical beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit and revenue on Tuesday, driven by growing demand for its surgical robots used in minimally invasive procedures.】

item.title: 墨西哥 Banorte 公司贷款额增长，利润增长 4
item.description: 墨西哥银行 Banorte 周二公布，受贷款规模扩大的推动，其第二季度净利润增长了 4%。【原文：Mexican lender Banorte on Tuesday reported a 4% bump in its second-quarter net profit, boosted by an expanding loan book.】

item.title: 墨西哥电信巨头 America Movil 第二季度扭亏为盈
item.description: 墨西哥电信巨头 America Movil 周二报告称，与 2024 年同期相比，公司第二季度净利润有所增长，达到 222.8 亿比索（11.9 亿美元）。【原文：Mexican telecommunications giant America Movil on Tuesday reported a swing to a net profit in the second quarter compared to the same period in 2024, reaching 22.28 billion pesos ($1.19 billion).】

item.title: 消息人士称康菲石油接近将俄克拉荷马州资产出售给 Stone Ridge Energy 公司
item.description: 三位熟知内情的人士周二告诉路透社，美国石油和天然气生产商康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）正在就以约 13 亿美元的价格向私营企业 Stone Ridge Energy 出售俄克拉荷马州的资产进行深入谈判。【原文：U.S. oil and gas producer ConocoPhillips is in advanced talks to sell assets in Oklahoma to privately owned Stone Ridge Energy for around $1.3 billion, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国参议员对达美航空利用人工智能制定机票价格的计划提出警告
item.description: 三位民主党参议员要求达美航空公司首席执行官埃德-巴斯蒂安（Ed Bastian）回答有关该公司计划使用人工智能制定机票价格的问题，并提出了对旅客影响的担忧。【原文：Three Democratic senators pressed Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian to answer questions about the airline's planned use of artificial intelligence to set ticket prices, raising concerns about the impact on travelers.】

item.title: Capital One 公布利润增长，原因是利息收入和费用增加
item.description: Capital One Financial 周二公布的第二季度调整后利润报告显示，由于信用卡债务利息收入增加和手续费收入增加，这家消费贷款公司的利润有所增长。【原文：Capital One Financial reported a rise in second-quarter adjusted profit on Tuesday, as the consumer lender was helped by a boost in interest income on its credit card debt and higher fee income.】

item.title: 贝克休斯第二季度利润超出预期，因天然气技术需求强劲
item.description: 油田服务供应商贝克休斯周二公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是受益于天然气服务的强劲需求。【原文：Oilfield services provider Baker Hughes surpassed Wall Street expectations for second-quarter profit on Tuesday, as it benefited from robust demand for its natural gas services.】

item.title: 交易日：科技股降温，特朗普对美联储的怒火熊熊燃烧
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 保险公司丘博第二季度利润因承保业务和投资收益强劲而增长
item.description: 保险公司丘博周二公布，由于承保业绩和投资回报的改善，第二季度利润有所增长。【原文：Insurance company Chubb reported a rise in second-quarter profit on Tuesday, helped by improved underwriting performance and investment returns.】

item.title: 喜剧演员支持哥伦比亚广播公司《晚间秀》主持人科尔伯特，乔恩-斯图尔特抨击派拉蒙公司
item.description: 在哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS）取消《深夜秀》（Late Show）主持人斯蒂芬-科尔伯特的节目后，深夜节目的竞争对手和其他名人团结起来支持他，喜剧演员乔恩-斯图尔特（Jon Stewart）抨击派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）决定终止这个长期播出的电视节目。【原文：Late-night rivals and other celebrities rallied to support CBS "Late Show" host Stephen Colbert after the network canceled his show, and comedian Jon Stewart lashed out at Paramount Global for the decision to end the long-running TV program.】
